title:
Should Internet Content & Information Stock Alphabet Inc Class C (GOOG) Be 
in Your Portfolio Thursday?
text:
Alphabet Inc Class C (GOOG) is around the top of the Internet Content & Information industry according to InvestorsObserver. GOOG received an overall rating of 80, which means that it scores higher than 80 percent of all stocks. Alphabet Inc Class C also achieved a score of 97 in the Internet Content & Information industry, putting it above 97 percent of Internet Content & Information stocks. Internet Content & Information is ranked 86 out of the 148 industries.





 GOOG has an Overall Score of 80. Find out what this means to you and get the rest of the rankings on GOOG!
See Full GOOG Report


What do These Ratings Mean?

Analyzing stocks can be hard. There are tons of numbers and ratios, and it can be hard to remember what they all mean and what counts as “good” for a given value. InvestorsObserver ranks stocks on eight different metrics. We percentile rank most of our scores to make it easy for investors to understand. A score of 80 means the stock is more attractive than 80 percent of stocks.


 

These rankings allows you to easily compare stocks and view what the strengths and weaknesses are of a given company. This lets you find the stocks with the best short and long term growth prospects in a matter of seconds. The combined score incorporates technical and fundamental analysis in order to give a comprehensive overview of a stocks performance. Investors who then want to focus on analysts rankings or valuations are able to see the separate scores for each section.

What's Happening With Alphabet Inc Class C Stock Today?
Alphabet Inc Class C (GOOG) stock is trading at $139.07 as of  12:46 PM on Thursday, Jan 4, a drop of -$1.29, or -0.92% from the previous closing price of $140.36. The stock has traded between  $138.96 and $140.64 so far today. Volume today is low. So far 6,173,339 shares have traded  compared to average volume of 22,810,452 shares.
